description: This is a market on whether the number of Americans that file weekly jobless claims will exceed 364,000 for the week ending on Saturday, July 3, 2021. This market will resolve to “Yes” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were more than 364,000 seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on July 3, 2021. This market will resolve to “No” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were 364,000 or less seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on July 3, 2021.  The resolution source for this market will be the United States Department of Labor’s Weekly Uninsurance Claims report for the week ending on Saturday, July 3, 2021, expected to be released on Thursday, July 8, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. If data is not available for the aforementioned dates by Wednesday, July 14, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

markets.question: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 364K for the week ending on July 3?

title: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 364K for the week ending on July 3?
